channel.title: NDTV News Search Records Found 1000
channel.description: NDTV.com provides the latest information from and in-depth coverage of India and the world. Find breaking news, India news, top stories, elections, politics, business, cricket, movies, lifestyle, health, live TV, videos, photos and more.

item.title: US President "Acknowledged" Elon Musk's Apology, Says White House

media:content.media:description: Elon Musk said in a post on X, "I regret some of my posts about President Donald Trump last week.

item.description: White House Press Secretary, Karoline Leavitt on Wednesday (local time) said that US President Donald Trump acknowledged Tesla CEO Elon Musk's apology for his comments.
item.content:encoded: White House Press Secretary, Karoline Leavitt on Wednesday (local time) said that US President Donald Trump acknowledged Tesla CEO Elon Musk's apology for his comments.

item.title: US Court Blocks Deportation Of Jailed Columbia Activist Mahmoud Khalil

media:content.media:description: "The Petitioner's career and reputation are being damaged", the US District Judge Michael Farbiarz said.

item.description: The Trump administration cannot use US foreign policy interests to justify its detention of Columbia University student and pro-Palestinian activist Mahmoud Khalil, a judge ruled on Wednesday, but stopped short of ordering Khalil's immediate release.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration cannot use US foreign policy interests to justify its detention of Columbia University student and pro-Palestinian activist Mahmoud Khalil, a judge ruled on Wednesday, but stopped short of ordering Khalil's immediate release.

item.title: "China, India Creating A Certain New Equilibrium", Says S Jaishankar

media:content.media:description: Mr Jaishankar said that apart from border issues, there are trade and economic issues as well.

item.description: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar while speaking at GMF Brussels Forum 2025 said that there is a complex equilibrium in the world as India and China have risen to power, and these countries also happen to be neighbours.
item.content:encoded: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar while speaking at GMF Brussels Forum 2025 said that there is a complex equilibrium in the world as India and China have risen to power, and these countries also happen to be neighbours.

item.title: Canada Town Near Vancouver Ready To Evacuate As Fire Nears

media:content.media:description: In recent years, Canada has experienced warming at least twice as fast as the rest of the globe.

item.description: Residents of a town near Vancouver were on stand-by to evacuate Wednesday as Canada's devastating wildfire season worsened, with officials warning weather conditions through the summer were ripe for further blazes.
item.content:encoded: Residents of a town near Vancouver were on stand-by to evacuate Wednesday as Canada's devastating wildfire season worsened, with officials warning weather conditions through the summer were ripe for further blazes.

item.title: NDTV Exclusive: Axiom-4 Launch Delays Unusual? Astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson Explains

media:content.media:description: Astrophysicist Neil deGrasse Tyson spoke to NDTV about the Axiom-4 mission and its delays.

item.description: SpaceX's Crew Dragon spacecraft, which will carry Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla and three other crew members to the International Space Station as part of the Axion-4 mission, was delayed again on Wednesday - for the fourth time since May 29.
item.content:encoded: <iframe title="Player" class="head-story__img img__full lazyload" height="300" scrolling=no frameborder=no src="about:blank" data-src="https://www.ndtv.com/video/embed-player/id/951405/play-via-app-wap?pWidth=100&pHeight=100&embed_type=story&site=classic&autostart=1"> </iframe>SpaceX's Crew Dragon spacecraft, which will carry Indian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla and three other crew members to the International Space Station as part of the Axion-4 mission, was delayed again on Wednesday - for the fourth time since May 29.

item.title: North Korea Will Always Stand With Russia, Kim Jong Un Tells Putin

media:content.media:description: KCNA reported on Wednesday that Kim had sent congratulations on Russia Day to Putin.

item.description: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un said in a message to Russian President Vladimir Putin that his country will always stand with Moscow, state media reported on Thursday.
item.content:encoded: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un said in a message to Russian President Vladimir Putin that his country will always stand with Moscow, state media reported on Thursday.

item.title: 'This Isn't real': Teacher's Narrow Escape From Austria School Shooter

media:content.media:description: Locals in Graz are struggling to express their shock

item.description: A teacher told AFP Wednesday how he found himself in a corridor with the shooter who killed 10 people in an Austrian school as he fled his empty classroom.
item.content:encoded: A teacher told AFP Wednesday how he found himself in a corridor with the shooter who killed 10 people in an Austrian school as he fled his empty classroom.

item.title: Trump Tries To "Liberate" Los Angeles, Meets With Resistance From Residents

media:content.media:description: Protesters believe that Trump's policy is undermining democracy and wreaking havoc.

item.description: US President Donald Trump says he sent in the National Guard and Marines to "liberate" Los Angeles from the violence of protesters, but some residents of Little Tokyo, a neighborhood hit hardest by the unrest say "no thanks" Mr. President.
item.content:encoded: US President Donald Trump says he sent in the National Guard and Marines to "liberate" Los Angeles from the violence of protesters, but some residents of Little Tokyo, a neighborhood hit hardest by the unrest say "no thanks" Mr. President.

item.title: At Least 3 Centuries-Old Monasteries Damaged In Greece Quake

media:content.media:description: Mt Athos has around 20 inhabited monasteries. (File)

item.description: At least three centuries-old Greek monasteries in the religious enclave of Mount Athos were damaged in an earthquake over the weekend, the culture ministry said Wednesday.
item.content:encoded: At least three centuries-old Greek monasteries in the religious enclave of Mount Athos were damaged in an earthquake over the weekend, the culture ministry said Wednesday.

item.title: Pakistan, Troubled By Thoughts Of A Deterrent For BrahMos, Looks Beyond China

media:content.media:description: The India-Russia developed BrahMos supersonic cruise missile can be fired from land, air, and sea

item.description: Ever since India's precision strikes first destroyed its terror infrastructure and later its air bases and military installations during Operation Sindoor, one question has kept Pakistan worried - How to defend itself against India's BrahMos missile?
item.content:encoded: Ever since India's precision strikes first destroyed its terror infrastructure and later its air bases and military installations during Operation Sindoor, one question has kept Pakistan worried - How to defend itself against India's BrahMos missile?

item.title: Trump Tells New US Citizens To "Fiercely Guard" The American Way Of Life

media:content.media:description: Donald Trump has called on newly naturalised citizens to "fiercely guard" the American way of life

item.description: In the address, Trump welcomes new citizens into what he calls the nation's "national family," emphasising that US citizenship is not just a legal status, but a "sacred honour" that carries profound responsibilities.
item.content:encoded: In the address, Trump welcomes new citizens into what he calls the nation's "national family," emphasising that US citizenship is not just a legal status, but a "sacred honour" that carries profound responsibilities.

item.title: Harvey Weinstein Found Guilty On A Sex Crimes Charge In New York Retrial
item.description: A Manhattan jury found Harvey Weinstein guilty on a sex crimes charge on Wednesday in a retrial after a state appeals court last year overturned the former movie mogul's 2020 conviction.
item.content:encoded: A Manhattan jury found Harvey Weinstein guilty on a sex crimes charge on Wednesday in a retrial after a state appeals court last year overturned the former movie mogul's 2020 conviction.

item.title: Lost Ship Carrying $16 Billion Treasure Confirmed As "World's Richest Shipwreck", Sparks Ownership Battle

media:content.media:description: The galleon was lost for more than 300 years beneath the waters of the Caribbean.

item.description: The find has sparked a multi-billion-pound legal battle over ownership of the gold, silver, and emeralds on board, which had lain undisturbed in the Caribbean waters for over 300 years.
item.content:encoded: The find has sparked a multi-billion-pound legal battle over ownership of the gold, silver, and emeralds on board, which had lain undisturbed in the Caribbean waters for over 300 years.

item.title: Mob Vandalises Tagore's Ancestral Home In Bangladesh Over Parking Dispute

media:content.media:description: Rabindranath Tagore's ancestral home in Bangladesh was vandalised by a mob

item.description: The incident sparked local outrage. On Tuesday, residents formed a human chain in protest, which was followed by a mob storming the premises. The auditorium of the Kachharibari was vandalised, and a director of the institution was physically attacked
item.content:encoded: The incident sparked local outrage. On Tuesday, residents formed a human chain in protest, which was followed by a mob storming the premises. The auditorium of the Kachharibari was vandalised, and a director of the institution was physically attacked

item.title: Visual Glitch Leads To Accidental Discovery Of Spiral In Mysterious Oort Cloud

media:content.media:description: The Oort Cloud is so far away from the Sun. (Representational)

item.description: Scientists have long assumed the Oort Cloud, one of the most mysterious structures in our solar system, to be spherical.
item.content:encoded: Scientists have long assumed the Oort Cloud, one of the most mysterious structures in our solar system, to be spherical.

item.title: Apple, Adidas Stores Looted As Los Angeles Protests Turn Violent
item.description: What began as protests against the immigration authorities-led raids in Los Angeles turned into a night of looting and vandalism on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded: What began as protests against the immigration authorities-led raids in Los Angeles turned into a night of looting and vandalism on Tuesday.

item.title: New T-Rex Ancestor Discovered In Drawers Of Mongolian Institute

media:content.media:description: The fossils were first dug up in southeastern Mongolia in the early 1970s.

item.description: Misidentified bones that languished in the drawers of a Mongolian institute for 50 years belong to a new species of tyrannosaur that rewrites the family history of the mighty T-Rex, scientists said Wednesday.
item.content:encoded: Misidentified bones that languished in the drawers of a Mongolian institute for 50 years belong to a new species of tyrannosaur that rewrites the family history of the mighty T-Rex, scientists said Wednesday.

item.title: Greta Thunberg Was Abused By Israeli Authorities, Says French Doctor

media:content.media:description: A French doctor who was on board the aid boat said that they were abusive towards passengers

item.description: The boat also had Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg onboard, and the doctor, Baptiste Andr said that the Israeli authorities mocked and deliberately deprived passengers of sleep, particularly Thunberg.
item.content:encoded: The boat also had Swedish climate activist Greta Thunberg onboard, and the doctor, Baptiste Andr said that the Israeli authorities mocked and deliberately deprived passengers of sleep, particularly Thunberg.

item.title: Need Both Pakistan And India, Islamabad "A Phenomenal Partner": Top US General

media:content.media:description: Top US General Michael Kurilla spoke about his coordination with Pak Army chief Asim Munir

item.description: A top US General, in a statement under oath, has stressed that Washington needs to have a strong relationship with both New Delhi and Islamabad/Rawalpindi, suggesting that the equation cannot be binary in nature.
item.content:encoded: <iframe title="Player" class="head-story__img img__full lazyload" height="300" scrolling=no frameborder=no src="about:blank" data-src="https://www.ndtv.com/video/embed-player/id/951264/play-via-app-wap?pWidth=100&pHeight=100&embed_type=story&site=classic&autostart=1"> </iframe>A top US General, in a statement under oath, has stressed that Washington needs to have a strong relationship with both New Delhi and Islamabad/Rawalpindi, suggesting that the equation cannot be binary in nature.

item.title: "Quick Peek": Solar Orbiter Spacecraft Obtains First Images Of Sun's Poles

media:content.media:description: The sun is located about 93 million miles (149 million km) from our planet.

item.description: The robotic Solar Orbiter spacecraft has obtained the first images ever taken of our sun's two poles as scientists seek a deeper understanding of Earth's host star, including its magnetic field, its 11-year cycle of activity and the solar wind.
item.content:encoded: The robotic Solar Orbiter spacecraft has obtained the first images ever taken of our sun's two poles as scientists seek a deeper understanding of Earth's host star, including its magnetic field, its 11-year cycle of activity and the solar wind.
